intro: Ceropegia tubata, commonly known as the tubular ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has succulent stems and leaves, which help it store water in arid environments. It is often grown as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. The flowers are pollinated by specific insects, showcasing a unique ecological relationship.
